summary: This bill, the "Strengthening Tactics to Obstruct the Population of Screwworms Act" (STOP Screwworms Act), mandates the Secretary of Agriculture to establish New World screwworm fly rearing facilities. These facilities will rear sterile flies for dispersal to areas at risk of infestation. The bill defines eligible areas based on migratory patterns and suitability for fly dispersal and requires annual reports to Congress and the public, analyzing the screwworm threat and the effectiveness of control efforts. It authorizes $300 million in appropriations for this initiative.
